Class Person

java.lang.Object
Person
Direct Known Subclasses:
Player, Zombie
public class Person
extends java.lang.Object
The person class represents a person that can move left, right, up, and down.
Version:
05/06/2021
Author:
Itai Reingold Nutman

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Person​(int x, int y, processing.core.PImage img, boolean shown)
    Initializes a person to an initial x coordinate, y coordinate, image, and visibility of the person.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void draw​(processing.core.PApplet marker)
    Draws the Person to the given Processing PApplet, if shown is true.
    double getHeight()
    Returns the height of the person.
    boolean getShown()
    Returns the visibility of the person.
    double getWidth()
    Returns the width of the person.
    double getX()
    Returns the x coordinate of the person
    double getY()
    Returns the y coordinate of the person
    void hide()
    Hides the person, the draw method will not draw anything.
    void moveX​(double xDistance)
    Moves the person x distance horizontally.
    void moveY​(double yDistance)
    Moves the person y distance vertically.
    void setShown​(boolean t)
    Make the shown field the input.
    void setX​(double xIn)
    Returns the y coordinate of the person
    void setY​(double yIn)
    set the y coordinate of the person.
    void show()
    Shows the person, the draw method will draw the person.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Person

      public Person​(int x, int y, processing.core.PImage img, boolean shown)
      Initializes a person to an initial x coordinate, y coordinate, image, and visibility of the person.
      Parameters:
      x - X-coordinate of the person
      y - Y - coordinate of the person
      img - the image of the person
      shown - decides the initial visibility of the person.

  • Method Details

    • moveX

      public void moveX​(double xDistance)
      Moves the person x distance horizontally.
      Parameters:
      xDistance - The change that will be done to the X-coordinate.

    • moveY

      public void moveY​(double yDistance)
      Moves the person y distance vertically.
      Parameters:
      yDistance - The change that will be done to the X-coordinate.

    • draw

      public void draw​(processing.core.PApplet marker)
      Draws the Person to the given Processing PApplet, if shown is true.
      Parameters:
      marker - The Processing PApplet on which to draw the Circle.
      Precondition:
      The Person will be drawn with attributes previously set on the given PApplet.

    • hide

      public void hide()
      Hides the person, the draw method will not draw anything. If shown is already false, shown remains false.

    • show

      public void show()
      Shows the person, the draw method will draw the person. If shown is already true, shown remains true.

    • getX

      public double getX()
      Returns the x coordinate of the person
      Returns:
      x-coordinate of the person

    • getY

      public double getY()
      Returns the y coordinate of the person
      Returns:
      y-coordinate of the person

    • setX

      public void setX​(double xIn)
      Returns the y coordinate of the person
      Parameters:
      xIn - - x to change to

    • setY

      public void setY​(double yIn)
      set the y coordinate of the person.
      Parameters:
      yIn - - y to change to.

    • getWidth

      public double getWidth()
      Returns the width of the person.
      Returns:
      width of the person.

    • getHeight

      public double getHeight()
      Returns the height of the person.
      Returns:
      height of the person.

    • setShown

      public void setShown​(boolean t)
      Make the shown field the input.
      Parameters:
      t - the boolean to change it to.

    • getShown

      public boolean getShown()
      Returns the visibility of the person.
      Returns:
      visibility of the person.
